item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 840) to amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide child care assistance to veterans receiving certain medical services provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs; providing for the adoption of the resolution (H. Res. 86) providing amounts for the expenses of the Select Committee on the Climate Crisis and the Select Committee on the Modernization of Congress; and providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 105, H. Res. 86 is considered passed House.
Passed/agreed to in House: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 105, H. Res. 86 is considered passed House.
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

summary.text: This resolution provides amounts for the expenses of the Select Committee on the Climate Crisis and the Select Committee on the Modernization of Congress. These amounts shall be made available beginning at noon on January 1, 2019, and ending on March 31, 2019.

This resolution provides amounts for the expenses of the Select Committee on the Climate Crisis and the Select Committee on the Modernization of Congress. These amounts shall be made available beginning at noon on January 1, 2019, and ending on March 31, 2019.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
